title: Easy Grilled Teriyaki Chicken Recipe
description: This grilled teriyaki chicken made with a super easy marinade and cooked to perfection on a hot grill is an easy summer meal that everyone will enjoy.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Main Dishes Chicken Chicken Teriyaki Recipes Easy Grilled Teriyaki Chicken 4.5 (466) 310 Reviews 17 Photos This grilled teriyaki chicken is very easy to prepare and great for a hot summer's evening. Leftovers are delicious on a green salad or in a sandwich. Be sure to grill very hot and very fast. Submitted by prissycat Updated on March 27, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 17 17 17 17 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Additional Time: 1 hr Total Time: 1 hr 30 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 1 cup teriyaki sauce ¼ cup lemon juice 2 teaspoons minced fresh garlic 2 teaspoons sesame oil 4 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves Directions Whisk teriyaki sauce, lemon juice, garlic, and sesame oil together in a bowl and pour into a resealable plastic bag. Add chicken, coat with marinade, squeeze out excess air, and seal the bag. Marinate in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour to overnight, turning every so often. When ready to cook, preheat an outdoor grill for high heat and lightly oil the grate. Remove chicken from marinade and shake off excess. Discard remaining marinade. Cook chicken on the preheated grill until no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, 6 to 8 minutes per side. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Editor's Note: The nutrition data for this recipe includes information for the full amount of the marinade ingredients. Depending on marinating time, ingredients, cooking method, etc., the actual amount of the marinade consumed will vary. I Made It Print 486 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Easy Grilled Teriyaki Chicken 01 of 17 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 17 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 06/24/2018 I found a new comfort food. Easy to make and grills up perfect. 03 of 17 Photo by  Krystel 01/12/2018 04 of 17 Photo by  dae777 10/01/2014 This was really good i only marinated it for 2 hours and used chicken breast tenders but flavor really good 05 of 17 Photo by  Chef J-A 07/20/2014 06 of 17 Photo by  PeaceLoveOkie85 07/15/2014 This recipe is very tasty. My husband inhaled his dinner and asked when we will be having this again! 07 of 17 Photo by  MN Nice 05/21/2012 I followed the recipe as written, but it really didn't do much for us. I thought there would be more flavor. 08 of 17 Photo by  amandak23k 11/07/2011 Simple and delicious!!! 09 of 17 Photo by  amandak23k 11/07/2011 Simple and delicious!!! 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Kevin's Teriyaki Chicken 92 Ratings Hawaiian Chicken Pineapple Kabobs 798 Ratings Spicy Chicken Breasts 704 Ratings Grilled Asian Chicken 552 Ratings RamJam Chicken 390 Ratings Chicken Satay 574 Ratings Chicken Kabobs 59 Ratings Easy Grilled Chicken 60 Ratings New York Finger Lakes Chicken 11 Ratings Easy Garlic Ginger Chicken 110 Ratings Texas BBQ Chicken 71 Ratings Grilled Peanut Chicken 438 Ratings Chili-Lime Chicken Kabobs 1,008 Ratings German Chicken 87 Ratings Juicy Grilled Chicken Breasts 504 Ratings Unbelievable Chicken 2,423 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: prissycat
instructions: Whisk teriyaki sauce, lemon juice, garlic, and sesame oil together in a bowl and pour into a resealable plastic bag. Add chicken, coat with marinade, squeeze out excess air, and seal the bag. Marinate in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour to overnight, turning every so often.;When ready to cook, preheat an outdoor grill for high heat and lightly oil the grate.;Remove chicken from marinade and shake off excess. Discard remaining marinade.;Cook chicken on the preheated grill until no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, 6 to 8 minutes per side. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
